popup.title: Southern Water Tribe
popup.description: The Southern Water Tribe is an independent state located at the South Pole and the southern division of the Water Tribes.

popup.title: Southern Air Temple
popup.description: The Southern Air Temple is one of the four original Air Nomad temples and one of the two that exclusively housed male airbenders.

popup.title: Patola Mountains
popup.description: The Patola Mountains are a mountain range located on an island in the South Sea, north of the South Pole.

popup.title: Kyoshi Island
popup.description: Kyoshi Island is a small island located off the southern coast of the Earth Kingdom, best known as the adopted home of Avatar Kyoshi.

popup.title: Omashu
popup.description: Omashu is the second largest city in the Earth Kingdom, surpassed in size and importance only by the capital city of Ba Sing Se.

popup.title: Mining village
popup.description: The mining village is a settlement in the Earth Kingdom. During the Hundred Year War, its inhabitants were forced to mine coal for the Fire Nation.

popup.title: Senlin Village
popup.description: Senlin Village is a small farming settlement located within the scorched forest. The surrounding woodland is protected by a spirit known as Hei Bai.

popup.title: Mo Ce Sea
popup.description: The Mo Ce Sea is an open body of water located between the western Earth Kingdom, eastern Fire Nation, and the United Republic of Nations.

popup.title: Crescent Island
popup.description: Crescent Island is a volcanic isle in the eastern Fire Nation that once housed a temple for the Fire Sages and a shrine to Avatar Roku.

popup.title: Seedy merchants pier
popup.description: Seedy merchants pier is a trading port that serves as a meeting-place for the Earth Kingdom's booming black market economy.

popup.title: Gaipan
popup.description: Gaipan was a small village in the Earth Kingdom. During a period of Fire Nation occupation, it was destroyed by a catastrophic man-made flood.

popup.title: Great Divide
popup.description: The Great Divide is a large canyon located in the rocky regions of the central Earth Kingdom and the largest canyon in the world.

popup.title: Harbor town
popup.description: The harbor town is a coastal settlement in the United Republic of Nations. It remained free from Fire Nation control during the Hundred Year War.

popup.title: Taku
popup.description: Taku is an abandoned city on the shores of the United Republic of Nations. The city was destroyed during the first years of the Hundred Year War.

popup.title: Pohuai Stronghold
popup.description: Pohuai Stronghold was a Fire Nation fortress located in the western Earth Kingdom and housed the legendary Yuyan Archers.

popup.title: Makapu Village
popup.description: Makapu Village is a small farming village located on the slopes of Mt. Makapu, and the residence of the fortuneteller Aunt Wu around 100 AG.

popup.title: Abbey
popup.description: This abbey is located near the shores of the Mo Ce Sea in the northern United Republic of Nations, formerly the northwestern Earth Kingdom.

popup.title: Fire Nation colonial village
popup.description: This Fire Nation colonial village was located in the northwestern Earth Kingdom. The village was a renowned cultural center during the colonial era.

popup.title: Northern Air Temple
popup.description: The Northern Air Temple was one of the four original Air Nomad temples and one of the two temples that exclusively housed male airbenders.

popup.title: Northern Water Tribe
popup.description: The Northern Water Tribe is an independent state located within the realms of the North Pole, and the oldest division of the three Water Tribes.

popup.title: General Fong's fortress
popup.description: General Fong's fortress was a secluded Earth Kingdom military facility situated in a mountain range on the west coast.

popup.title: Cave of Two Lovers
popup.description: The Cave of Two Lovers, also know as the Secret Tunnel, is a series of caverns near the city of Omashu which pass underneath the Kolau Mountain Range.

popup.title: Kolau Mountains
popup.description: The Kolau Mountains are a large chain of mountains in the Earth Kingdom, famous for encompassing both the Cave of Two Lovers and the city of Omashu.

popup.title: Foggy Swamp
popup.description: The Foggy Swamp is a vast wetland covering a large portion of the southwestern Earth Kingdom. At the center stands an enormous banyan-grove tree.

popup.title: Chin Village
popup.description: Chin Village is a town located on the cliffs of the Earth Kingdom's southwestern coast. It was named after Chin the Conqueror.

popup.title: Gaoling
popup.description: Gaoling is a large town located within a mountain range in the southern Earth Kingdom, and home to the wealthy Beifong family.

popup.title: Plains village
popup.description: The plains village is a small, poor town located in arid plains of the southern Earth Kingdom.

popup.title: Tu Zin
popup.description: Tu Zin is a small, abandoned village located near a mountainous region of the southern Earth Kingdom, some distance from the expansive Si Wong Desert.

popup.title: Quarry campsite
popup.description: The quarry campsite is located in a quarry in the southeastern Earth Kingdom.

popup.title: Wan Shi Tong's Library
popup.description: Wan Shi Tong's Library is an enormous library located in the Spirit World. Until 100 AG, it was a popular destination for many adventurers.

popup.title: Si Wong Desert
popup.description: The Si Wong Desert is an arid region located in the central Earth Kingdom. It is the largest, driest, and hottest desert on Earth.

popup.title: Full Moon Bay
popup.description: Full Moon Bay is a secluded cove in the East Lake and the location of a hidden ferry station for refugees travelling to the capital of Ba Sing Se.

popup.title: Serpent's Pass
popup.description: The Serpent's Pass is a narrow strip of land located between the East and West Lakes, named for the fearsome serpent which guards it.

popup.title: Outer wall of Ba Sing Se
popup.description: At one hundred meters tall, Ba Sing Se's Outer Wall is the city's first line of defense, and the largest man-made structure in the world.

popup.title: Ba Sing Se
popup.description: Ba Sing Se is the capital of the Earth Kingdom. The largest city in the World of Avatar, it is renowned for its supposedly impenetrable outer walls.

popup.title: Agrarian Zone
popup.description: The Agrarian Zone is a large, underdeveloped area between the Outer and Inner Walls of Ba Sing Se, used mainly for agricultural purposes.

popup.title: Lake Laogai
popup.description: Lake Laogai is a large body of water located within the Agrarian Zone of Ba Sing Se. Hidden beneath was the Dai Li's secret base of operations.

popup.title: Chameleon Bay
popup.description: Chameleon Bay is a small inlet located near the northern waters of the Eastern Sea in the northeastern Earth Kingdom.

popup.title: Eastern Air Temple
popup.description: The Eastern Air Temple is one of the four original temples of the Air Nomads, and one of two that exclusively housed female airbenders.

popup.title: Earth Kingdom Royal Palace
popup.description: The Earth Kingdom Royal Palace is at the very center of Ba Sing Se and the home of the earth monarch and the seat of the Earth Kingdom's government.

popup.title: Fire Nation bazaar
popup.description: The Fire Nation bazaar is a large, open-air market, suitable for selling or purchasing a variety of top-quality Fire Nation trinkets.

popup.title: Jang Hui
popup.description: Jang Hui is a small fishing village in one of the islands of the Fire Nation, made up of houseboats and buildings on stilts, connected by bridges.

popup.title: Shu Jing
popup.description: Shu Jing is a town located on one of the eastern islands of the Fire Nation and the home of renowned swordmaster Piandao.

popup.title: Ember Island
popup.description: Ember Island is a resort area located in the outer islands of the northern Fire Nation, and home to many vacation homes for the wealthy and powerful.

popup.title: Roku's island
popup.description: Roku's island is a small Fire Nation isle and Avatar Roku's home in his later years. It was destroyed following a catastrophic volcanic eruption.

popup.title: Fire Fountain City
popup.description: Fire Fountain City is a large industrialized city located on Shuhon Island. It is named for the large statue of Fire Lord Ozai at its center.

popup.title: Hama's village
popup.description: This village is a small town located in one of the central islands of the Fire Nation, and the adopted home of waterbender Hama.

popup.title: Black Cliffs
popup.description: The Black Cliffs are a series of coastal cliff-faces located near an uninhabited inner island in the Fire Nation, forming a natural secluded bay.

popup.title: Great Gates of Azulon
popup.description: The Great Gates of Azulon are a massive set of fiery nets that guard the sea entrance to the Fire Nation Capital.

popup.title: Fire Nation Capital
popup.description: The Fire Nation Capital is located on Capital Island and home to the Fire Lord, the Fire Nation Royal Family, and Fire Nation nobility.

popup.title: Fire Nation Royal Palace
popup.description: The Fire Nation Royal Palace is the home of the Fire Nation Royal Family, and located at the center of the Caldera City crater in the Capital.

popup.title: Western Air Temple
popup.description: The Western Air Temple is one of the four original temples of the Air Nomads and one of two that exclusively housed female airbenders.

popup.title: Sun Warriors' ancient city
popup.description: The Sun Warriors' ancient city is a large settlement on an island north of the Fire Nation mainland, inhabited by the lost Sun Warrior civilization.

popup.title: Boiling Rock
popup.description: The Boiling Rock is a secure Fire Nation prison for the most dangerous criminals. It is situated on a volcanic island in the middle of a boiling lake.

popup.title: Yon Rha's village
popup.description: Yon Rha's village is a minor settlement located in the southern Fire Nation, and the home of former Southern Raiders commander Yon Rha.

popup.title: Wulong Forest
popup.description: Wulong Forest is a geographical feature on the coast of the United Republic of Nations, with hundreds of rock columns towering over the landscape.

popup.title: Eastern Sea
popup.description: The Eastern Sea is an extensive body of water that extends from the eastern coast of the Earth Kingdom to the northeastern shores of the South Pole.

popup.title: Whaletail Island
popup.description: Whaletail Island is an island territory situated on the South Sea. It gets its name from its distinctive shape, which resembles a whale's tail.

popup.title: Elephant koi
popup.description: Aang's favourite spot to ride elephant koi.

popup.title: Hopping llamas
popup.description: Aang's favourite spot to ride hopping llamas.

popup.title: Hog monkeys
popup.description: Aang's favourite spot to ride hog monkeys.

popup.title: Air Temple Island
popup.description: Air Temple Island is a small isle built by Avatar Aang located off the coast of Republic City in Yue Bay.

popup.title: Aang Memorial Island
popup.description: Aang Memorial Island is a small island located in Yue Bay. It features a massive statue of Avatar Aang that was commissioned by the Fire Nation.

popup.title: Pro-bending Arena
popup.description: The Pro-bending Arena is a large golden building that hosts official pro-bending matches in Republic City, and a prominent city landmark.

popup.title: Police headquarters
popup.description: The police headquarters is one of the oldest buildings in Republic City, and served as the base of operations for the Republic City Police.

popup.title: City Hall
popup.description: The former City Hall was originally the offices of the United Republic Council, and later transformed to house the official seat of the president.

popup.title: Avatar Korra Park
popup.description: Avatar Korra Park is a recreational area in Republic City's central peninsula, and due to high levels of poverty home to a large number of vagabonds.

popup.title: Central City Station
popup.description: Central City Station is the central train station in Republic City. A monument of Fire Lord Zuko is located in the center of the plaza.

popup.title: Future Industries
popup.description: Future Industries is a large business conglomerate run by the Sato family. The factory produces over one hundred luxury Satomobiles on a daily basis.

popup.title: Northern Sea
popup.description: The Northern Sea is a large, open body of water located between the northern Earth Kingdom and the Northern Water Tribe.

popup.title: Southern spirit portal
popup.description: The Southern spirit portal is one of the two original spirit portals, situated at the center of an ancient forest at the heart of the South Pole.

popup.title: Northern spirit portal
popup.description: The Northern spirit portal is one of the two original spirit portals, situated at the center of an ancient forest at the heart of the North Pole.

popup.title: Bhanti Island
popup.description: The Bhanti consists of a group of sages who live in a village located on Bhanti Island in the southern Fire Nation, and predate the first Avatar.

popup.title: Zaofu
popup.description: Zaofu is an autonomous city-state located in the southwestern Earth Kingdom. Founded by Suyin Beifong, it is constructed entirely out of metal.

popup.title: Laghima's Peak
popup.description: Laghima's Peak is a large mountain formation ten miles from the Northern Air Temple. It is named after renowned Air Nomad poet, Guru Laghima.
